meaningMnemonic:
These <kanji>medicine</kanji> <kanji>thing</kanji>s are of the bad kind, they're <vocabulary>drugs</vocabulary>!

As a standalone word, 薬物 generally refers to (often) illegal drugs that cause addiction or have a stimulating effect. Depending on the context, it can also refer to pharmaceutical drugs (aka <vocabulary>medicine</vocabulary>), but in that case, it's usually used in compounds like 薬物アレルギー (drug allergy).
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
